Description: Nile silt pottery jar coated with red slip and burnished; with small flat base, ovoid body tapering into short neck and roll-over rim. Lightly incised post-firing on side with an ‘hour-glass’ potmark; base also incised with a single line.
Curator's comments: Marked U on base. Polished red ware P40c in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Potmark on side illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xxi.84 (not to scale), there attributed to grave U57.
